name: 徐曉萱
objective:
This course enables students to understand the fundamental concepts in materials science, modern theory of solids, and semiconductor physics. It will also cover the introduction of electronic devices and semiconductor processing currently used in the semiconductor industry. Additionally, students will learn the basic concepts of solar cells, including the working principles, material selection, and applications.
(Course taught in English)
schedule:
1. Introduction 
2. Elementary Materials Science Concepts 
3. Electrical  Conduction in Solids 
4. Elementary Quantum Physics
5. Fundamentals of Semiconductor 
6. Semiconductor Devices (LED and Solar Cell) 
7. Materials processing and fabrication
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam: 40%
Final Exam: 40 %
Class Participation: 20% (Homework, Classwork, Attendance)

1. Principles of Electronic Materials and Devices, Third Edition, S. O. Kasap, McGraw-Hill, 2006 ISBN 007-124458-1 
2.Semiconductor Physics & Devices Basic Principles 4/E, D. A. Neamen,  McGrawHill, 2012, ISBN：9780071089029
